maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve a list of available Agents and/or Teams
This functions retrieves the RES AM agents. The Agent parameter allows a RegEx to specify which agents shall be returned. With the available switches, the returned RES AM agents can be fine-tuned
The hostname of the RES Automation Manager Dispatcher that is used to access the WebAPI
The credential used to authenticate to the RES Automation Manager REST interface
A RegEx expression that defines the names of the RES AM agents the function needs to retrieve.
A switch to specify that RES AM Agents shall be returned
A switch to specify that RES AM Teams shall be returned
A switch to specify that only online RES AM agents shall be returned
A switch to specify that only licensed RES AM agents shall be returned.
The hostname of the RES Automation Manager Dispatcher that is used to access the WebAPI
The credential used to authenticate to the RES Automation Manager REST interface
A RegEx expression that defines the names of the RES AM agents the function needs to retrieve.
A switch to specify that RES AM Agents shall be returned
A switch to specify that RES AM Teams shall be returned
A switch to specify that only online RES AM agents shall be returned
A switch to specify that only licensed RES AM agents shall be returned.
Retrieve a list of input parameters for a Module, Project or Run Book
Get the input parameters for a Module, Project or RunBook
The hostname of the RES Automation Manager Dispatcher that is used to access the WebAPI
The credential used to authenticate to the RES Automation Manager REST interface
The Module, Project or Runbook object, for which you want to retrieve the input parameters
Switch for internal use. Returns the raw object as returned by the REST interface
The hostname of the RES Automation Manager Dispatcher that is used to access the WebAPI
The credential used to authenticate to the RES Automation Manager REST interface
The Module, Project or Runbook object, for which you want to retrieve the input parameters
Switch for internal use. Returns the raw object as returned by the REST interface
Retrieve a list of Jobs
Get job objects that comply with the specified requirements. By default all jobs, except for recurring and RunBook jobs, are returned.
The hostname of the RES Automation Manager Dispatcher that is used to access the WebAPI
The credential used to authenticate to the RES Automation Manager REST interface
The number of Job objects to return.
A DateTime that defines the start of the interval for which the jobs shall be returned
A DateTime that defines the end of the interval for which the jobs shall be returned
The jobs are by default returned most recent to oldest. With this switch the order can be reversed.
The stage of the jobs to be returned.
A switch to specify if RunBook jobs shall be returned as well.
A switch to specify if recurring jobs shall be returned
The name or description that was given to the job(s).
The hostname of the RES Automation Manager Dispatcher that is used to access the WebAPI
The credential used to authenticate to the RES Automation Manager REST interface
The number of Job objects to return.
A DateTime that defines the start of the interval for which the jobs shall be returned
A DateTime that defines the end of the interval for which the jobs shall be returned
The jobs are by default returned most recent to oldest. With this switch the order can be reversed.
The stage of the jobs to be returned.
A switch to specify if RunBook jobs shall be returned as well.
A switch to specify if recurring jobs shall be returned
The name or description that was given to the job(s).
Retrieve a Job by it's ID
Retrieve a specific job. The ID parameter needs to be the ID property of an existing job.
The hostname of the RES Automation Manager Dispatcher that is used to access the WebAPI
The credential used to authenticate to the RES Automation Manager REST interface
The ID property from a Job object.
The hostname of the RES Automation Manager Dispatcher that is used to access the WebAPI
The credential used to authenticate to the RES Automation Manager REST interface
The ID property from a Job object.
Retrieve Job results
Retrieve the summary or detailed results of a specific Job.
The hostname of the RES Automation Manager Dispatcher that is used to access the WebAPI
The credential used to authenticate to the RES Automation Manager REST interface
The ID of a specific Job
A switch to specify that summary of the Job results shall be returned.
A switch that specifies that the detailed job results shall be returned
The hostname of the RES Automation Manager Dispatcher that is used to access the WebAPI
The credential used to authenticate to the RES Automation Manager REST interface
The ID of a specific Job
A switch to specify that summary of the Job results shall be returned.
A switch that specifies that the detailed job results shall be returned
Retrieve a list of available Modules
Retrieves all the available Modules. With a RegEx expression the function can return specific Modules.
The hostname of the RES Automation Manager Dispatcher that is used to access the WebAPI
The credential used to authenticate to the RES Automation Manager REST interface
A RegEx to specify which Modules to return
The hostname of the RES Automation Manager Dispatcher that is used to access the WebAPI
The credential used to authenticate to the RES Automation Manager REST interface
A RegEx to specify which Modules to return
Retrieve a list of available Projects
Retrieves all the available Modules. With a RegEx expression the function can return specific Projects.
The hostname of the RES Automation Manager Dispatcher that is used to access the WebAPI
The credential used to authenticate to the RES Automation Manager REST interface
A RegEx to specify which Projects to return
The hostname of the RES Automation Manager Dispatcher that is used to access the WebAPI
The credential used to authenticate to the RES Automation Manager REST interface
A RegEx to specify which Projects to return
Retrieve a list of available Run Books
Retrieves all the available Modules. With a RegEx expression the function can return specific RunBooks.
The hostname of the RES Automation Manager Dispatcher that is used to access the WebAPI
The credential used to authenticate to the RES Automation Manager REST interface
A RegEx to specify which RunBooks to return

The credential used to authenticate to the RES Automation Manager REST interface
A RegEx to specify which RunBooks to return

Schedule a new Job
Schedule a Module, Project or RunBook on a one or more Agents at a specific time.

The name to assign to the Job, Module or RunBook.
One or more Agents where to schedule the Job
The Module to be scheduled
The DateTime when to schedule the Job
A switch to indicate that the Job shall be scheduled immediately.
A switch to indicate that the Start time is expressed in the local time.
A switch that indicates if the Job can use Wake On LAN for the Agents, when they are not connected.

Retrieve a list of RES AM jobs
Retrieves all RES AM jobs for a specific time interval. The time interval is specified with the Start and Finish parameters.
The hostname of the RES Automation Manager Dispatcher that is used to access the WebAPI
The credential used to authenticate to the RES Automation Manager REST interface
A DateTime that defines the start of the interval for which the jobs shall be returned
A DateTime that defines the end of the interval for which the jobs shall be returned

The credential used to authenticate to the RES Automation Manager REST interface
A DateTime that defines the start of the interval for which the jobs shall be returned
A DateTime that defines the end of the interval for which the jobs shall be returned

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieve the RES AN jobs for the last 24 hours

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieve a list of all RES AM Teams
This cmdlet fetches all RES AM Teams. In the returned object the Agents that are member of the Team are listed.
The hostname of the RES Automation Manager Dispatcher that is used to access the WebAPI
The credential used to authenticate to the RES Automation Manager REST interface
The hostname of the RES Automation Manager Dispatcher that is used to access the WebAPI
The credential used to authenticate to the RES Automation Manager REST interface
